title: How to watch NFL free live stream today : Detroit Lions vs . Philadelphia Eagles
body_text:
A loaded slate of NFL games on Sunday, Nov. 16 concludes at Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia where the defending champion Philadelphia Eagles host the Detroit Lions.
This NFL game is scheduled to start at 8:20 p.m. EST and will be broadcast on NBC and NBC Universo. Fans looking to watch can do so for free by using DIRECTV, which offers a free trial, or FuboTV, which also offers a free trial as well as up to $30 off your first month. SlingTV doesn’t offer a free trial but has promotional offers available for streaming the game, and NFL+ airs all local market games, and NFL+ Premium allows fans to watch NFL RedZone, condensed game replays and all-22 coaches film. Peacock has plans starting at $7.99 a month and allows fans to watch Sunday Night Football games along with any other game broadcast on NBC.
The Eagles are 7-2 after a 10-7 victory on the road against another NFC North squad, the Green Bay Packers. Philadelphia’s defense forced a pair of crucial fumbles to help secure the win while Jalen Hurts had just 183 passing yards and a score with DeVonta Smith catching the touchdown and getting 69 yards on four catches while Saquon Barkley had 60 rushing yards and a 41-yard reception to set up the touchdown.
The Lions are 6-3 and coming off a 44-22 victory over a different NFC East opponent, the Washington Commanders. Dan Campbell took over play calling duties as the offense had 546 yards. Now he leads them into a matchup with the only NFC team he has not defeated since becoming Detroit’s coach. Jared Goff tossed for 320 yards and three scores while Jahmyr Gibbs went for 142 rushing yards and two scores last week. Jameson Williams had six catches for 119 yards and a score while Amon-Ra St. Brown had a score and 58 yards on five grabs.
Who: Detroit Lions vs. Philadelphia Eagles
When: Sunday, Nov. 16 at 8:20 p.m. EST
Where: Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia
Stream: DIRECTV (free trial); FuboTV (free trial); SlingTV; Peacock; NFL+
What is DIRECTV?
DIRECTV is an internet TV service that offers your favorite entertainment, news and sports channels, as well as local TV stations and regional sports networks. Sign up now and get three free months of premium channels including HBO Max, Paramount+ with SHOWTIME and Starz.
What is FuboTV?
FuboTV is an internet television service that offers more than 200 channels across sports and entertainment including Paramount+ with SHOWTIME. From the UEFA Champions League to the WNBA to international tournaments ranging across sports, there’s plenty of options available on FuboTV, which offers a free trial and up to $30 off the first month for new customers.
What is Sling TV?
Sling TV offers a variety of live programming ranging from news and sports and starting as low as $20 a month for your first month. Subscribers also get a month of DVR Plus free if they sign up now. Choose from a variety of sports packages without long-term contracts and with easy cancellation.
What is Peacock?
Peacock offers a variety of sports, including: NFL, MLB, NCAA (football and basketball), Premier League, NBA, NASCAR, PGA Tour, and more. The dedicated “Sports” section within Peacock provides replays, news and analysis. Sports airing on NBC, NBC Sports, USA Network, NBC Universo and Telemundo will be available to you if you have the right Peacock plan. Peacock Premium costs $10.99 per month or $109.99 per year. Peacock Premium Plus costs $16.99 per month, and includes all the same content as Peacock Premium, but without ads. Premium Plus subscribers can also download and watch select titles on the go, and stream their local NBC affiliate.
What is NFL+?
NFL+ and NFL+ Premium allow fans access to the most NFL content available online. From game replays, coaches’ film and all-22 field angles of the games to NFL Network original programming, NFL+ and NFL+ Premium allow fans to stay fully locked in with every NFL team no matter where you are in the country.
